alert.note: Alert for Grady; Thomas (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 1:20PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Jefferson, northeastern Leon, southern Grady and southwestern Thomas Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 120 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles south of Whigham to 14 miles east of Havana to 7 miles east of Tallahassee. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tallahassee, Monticello, Alma, Miccosukee Road Greenway, Rocky Hill, Miccosukee, Drifton, Calvary, Killearn Estates, Casa Blanco, Pisgah Church, Lake Miccosukee, Fincher, Moncrief, Festus, Lake Iamonia, Baum, Lois, Killearn Lakes and Reno. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
